com.example.ARmirrorS

Class MirrorApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Application
          • com.example.ARmirrorS.MirrorApp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2

    public class MirrorApp
extends android.app.Application

    Class MirrorApp

    Class MirrorApp extends Application, run initially before any other activities in the application and is used to store global variables and mainly handle web socket interactions in case of server or client connection.

    Since:
    2019-12-05
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Yussuf Khalil, Daniel King, ykhalil2@illinois.edu, dking32@illinois.edu
    See Also:
    Application, OpenCVLoader

        private static InetAddress getInetAddress()

        Returns:
        InetAddress of running Phone Interface.

      • startClient

        private static void startClient(URI uri)
        Attempts to connect to Server from Client Side at a specific IP address and Port. This uses a blocking connect open method for 2 seconds.
        Parameters:
        uri - default URI for Samsung phones ws:192.168.43.1:12345

      • getWebSocketServerStatus

        public static String getWebSocketServerStatus()
        Obtain the server Status. If it is running and if it is communicating with any clients.
        Returns:
        Server Status.

      • getClientStatus

        public static String getClientStatus()
        Obtains the client status. This is only used by the server to display a simplified version of how many clients are connected at a certain time.
        Returns:
        number of clients connected to server if any.

      • startWebSocketServer

        public static void startWebSocketServer()
        Wrapper around startServer() method to start the server.

      • setInteractionLevel

        public static void setInteractionLevel(int value)
        Sets the interaction level and if it is Easy or Expert Mode.
        Parameters:
        value - interactionLevel with the server subtraction algorithms | Expert or Easy.

      • setUserMode

        public static void setUserMode(int setUserMode)
        Sets the user mode of the application. i.e. Server or client application mode.
        Parameters:
        setUserMode - | server or client.

      • getIsClientConnected

        public static boolean getIsClientConnected()
        Deprecated. since version 1.1.
        Checks to see if any clients are connected to the server or not.
        Returns:
        true or false if clients are connected to server.

      • setTimerStatus

        public static void setTimerStatus(boolean value)
        Sets the 15 sec. Timer for capturing first frame in case used of the server selects Absolute Difference subtraction Algorithm.
        Parameters:
        value - boolean flag to set the absolute Difference Subtraction Method Timer.

      • getInteractionLevel

        public static int getInteractionLevel()
        Obtain the Server user interaction method used for displaying purposes for corresponding activity.
        Returns:
        interactionLevel | Easy or Expert mode

      • getUserMode

        public static int getUserMode()
        Obtain the user mode of the application. i.e. Application is running as a server or a client.
        Returns:
        userMode | Server or Client

        Deprecated. since version 1.1.
        Retrieves Server WebSocket object reference.
        Returns:
        webSocketServer object ref.

      • getTimerStatus

        public static boolean getTimerStatus()
        Retrieves the status of the timer for Frame subtraction absolute difference method.
        Returns:
        timerRunning boolean flag.

      • sendMessage2Clients

        public static void sendMessage2Clients(ByteBuffer blob)
        Send a byte array message to all connected clients by the server with the masked processed current frame stored in a byteBuffer object.
        Parameters:
        blob - ByteBuffer object to store all rotation values of tiles to be sent to client.

      • startWebSocketClientConnection

        public static void startWebSocketClientConnection(URI uri)
        Wrapper function around startClient() method to start Client WebSocket object with a specific URI and IP address in case default one is not valid.
        Parameters:
        uri - default URI for Samsung Phones ws://192.168.43.1:12345

      • startWebSocketClientREConnection

        public static void startWebSocketClientREConnection()
        Non Blocking call to attempt to restart WebSocket Client in case we are unable to connect to server on first blocking attempt.

      • getWebSocketClientStatus

        public static String getWebSocketClientStatus()
        Return the current Status of the Clients connected to server.
        Returns:
        ClientStatus used by Client sied of application only and not the server

      • sendMessage2Server

        public static void sendMessage2Server(String message)
        Sends a String/Text message to server with Setup and Display parameters.
        Parameters:
        message - parameters message to send to server.

      • sendMessage2Server

        public static void sendMessage2Server(ByteBuffer blob)
        Send a byte Array message to server from Client. Currently, server ignores all traffic from clients that is not text based.
        Parameters:
        blob - byte array to send to server

      • getContext

        public static android.content.Context getContext()
        get the application main Context.
        Returns:
        sContext Application Running Context

      • getNoOFTiles

        public static int getNoOFTiles()
        get number of tiles to display on frame.
        Returns:
        noTiles number of tiles per row (32/ 26/ 22/ or 16)

      • setNoOFTiles

        public static void setNoOFTiles(int value)
        set the number of tiles to display in vertical and horizontal axis. can be either 32, 26, 22, or 16 tiles per row and column.
        Parameters:
        value - number of tiles per row/column

      • getTileMaterial

        public static int getTileMaterial()
        Get the tile material used for client display purpose.
        Returns:
        tileMaterial ( Walnut/ Oak/ Bronze/ Copper)

      • setTileMaterial

        public static void setTileMaterial(int value)
        Set the Tile Material used for Displaying. it can be oak, walnut, bronze, or copper.
        Parameters:
        value - Material Type used for display of tiles

      • getTileShape

        public static int getTileShape()
        get the tile shapes selected by client.
        Returns:
        tileShape ( Square/ Circle/ Triangle)

      • setTileShape

        public static void setTileShape(int value)
        Set the tiles shape to display to client. Either Square, Triangle or Circle.
        Parameters:
        value - Tiles Shape (Square/ Circle/ Triangle)

      • getStartStream

        public static boolean getStartStream()
        Check to see if the Client is ready to stream processed frames and masks from the server.
        Returns:
        startStream boolean flag indicating whether to send frames to clients or not.

      • setStartStream

        public static void setStartStream(boolean value)
        Sets the startStream Flag if the client has indicated to server that it is ready to receive processed masked frames to display.
        Parameters:
        value - true or false to set startStream flag.

      • getDetectionMode

        public static int getDetectionMode()
        Retrieve the plane detection method used by ARCore to place tiles and mirror.
        Returns:
        mirrorPlacement (vertical / horizontal or Augmented Image)

      • setDetectionMode

        public static void setDetectionMode(int value)
        Sets the detection mode of ARCore to track horizontal or vertical or Augmented image planes.
        Parameters:
        value - detection plane (horizontal/ Vertical/ Augmented-Image)
